Recap: Dinah runs into a fortune teller at a carnival. Later at home Dinah argues with Vanessa about Clarrisa, Blake's daughter. Clarrisa is staying with Vanessa while Blake is in the hospital. Vanessa tells Dinah that a hearing is set for Clarrisa's case. And also Clarrisa is down. Dinah goes to talk to an unconsious Blake. Mallet talks with Vanessa. Vanessa bought the TV Station. Mallet later catches up with Dinah. TV Crews follow them. Dinah threatens to leave town if Mallet doesn't tell her he loves her. Mallet stops her. Later at the Carnival Dinah and Clarrisa talk. Dinah tells Clarrisa about being raised in a Carnival. While a smiling Mallet watches. Dinah has had it with the camera crew, so she tells them what she think they want to hear. Mallet wants Dinah to promise not to leave him.
Transcript: Fortune teller: Every month has it's moons. January brings the wolf moon. September, the harvest moon. And November, the frost moon, among the brightest of the winter skies. They call it the Frost Moon Festival. The town Springfield was founded by trailblazers who followed the frost moon, hoping it would lead them out of the wilderness in to a safe place they could call home. Hundreds of years later, it is still believed the frost moon lights a path to guide those who have lost their way.
Dinah: Oh, oh!
Fortune teller: I see great love in your future, my dear.
Dinah: Yeah, that was the past.
Fortune teller: Miss, you are mistaken.

Dinah: Let me tell you something, lady, I grew up in all of this. The sword swallower, that's fake. And the three-faced man, that's fake. And especially you-- you, you're something else. You sell false hopes to fools, that's what you do.

(Knock on the door)

Dinah: I need to go downtown for a little while. Don't worry. Okay, I'll be fine. I'll give you a call when I get back.
Vanessa: Stop right there. Okay, talk to me.

Vanessa: "He" being Mallet?

Dinah: Yeah. And, actually, it gets better. He pretended to want to protect me, and then he actually tried to trick me into going to the police station. So really, he used it all against me, you know. That was our biggest problem, Mom, if you remember. It was trust, and he used that against me. So that's almost like a gun, if you ask me.
Vanessa: Yeah, or poison.

Vanessa: No, no, no, I don't. I'm just thinking that possibly Detective Mallet might have been trying to...

Vanessa: No.

Vanessa: No, no, Dinah. He's not here. I haven't talked to him. I was just trying to say that possibly he was trying to protect you.
Dinah: What are you talking about, Mom? I thought that you of all would believe in me. I have a turned my life around. What do I have to do to catch a break in this town?
Vanessa: I do believe in you, Dinah. I do. I just know that running is not the answer.
Dinah: Well, it worked for me when I killed Hart, so...
Vanessa: Yeah, but you haven't done anything wrong this time.
Dinah: It doesn't matter, Mom. Because when I do the right thing, no one believes me.
Vanessa: Oh, Dinah...
Dinah: I can't get anybody in this town to love me without doubting me.
Clarissa: Are you leaving me, too?

Dinah: Oh, Blakey, I know. I know. Got a little scare there for a second, didn't you? I'm not going to hurt you because daddy wouldn't want me to do that. He would want me to try to help you. And I'm not even sure if I can do that. But I won't hurt you because of him and because of your children. But... I do know what it's like to be lost and angry and want to hurt people because someone hurt you. I guess that's how you felt when daddy died. You felt lost. In fact, you lost it when you lost him, didn't you? Really, I can't say that I blame you. Because I don't think any of us have felt really safe without him. But, Blake, honey, you have kids to think about. And what I don't understand is why you did something like this. They deserve to feel safe with you. And you didn't do that. You don't leave children by the side of the road and expect them to find their way home. You don't do that. You protect them, no matter what you're going through, you protect them. Well, I think I figured something out. I think I have my father in me somewhere deep down inside of me. And I'm going to tell you something: I don't want to end up like this. I don't want to end up like you. And I will do whatever it takes to make sure that doesn't happen. I hope that you get well. Quickly. You take care.
